intro: Fimbristylis longispica, commonly known as the long-bristled sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in wetland and marshy environments. The plant produces small, three-lobed seeds that are dispersed by wind. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
